SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is well differentiated.
A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is moderately differentiated.
A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is poorly differentiated.
A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is undifferentiated.
A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that the grade of a cancerous lesion cannot be assessed.
